version_description:
Introducing the all new GoodNotes 5 - A single place for all your formerly paper-based information.

GoodNotes 5 is a major update to its predecessor GoodNotes 4. It includes many highly requested features, improvements to existing things and some special surprises.

What's new in GoodNotes 5:
- New folder system: Create unlimited levels of folders and subfolders
- Text & handwriting search across all documents
- Flexible scrolling directions: Horizontal or vertical scrolling
- Favorites view: Shortcuts to important pages, documents, or folders.
- QuickNotes: The fastest way to start taking notes
- Optionally display documents as lists instead of thumbnails
- Improved ink algorithm: More precise and natural writing experience
- New pen style: Brush Pen for artistic sketches and notes
- Improved Shapes tool: Color fill shapes and make lines snap
- Rebuilt toolbar: Faster access to all tools and settings
- Handwriting rotation: rotate handwriting and sketches with the Lasso Tool
- Better rich text editing & more fonts: Use various colors, font sizes, and styles in a single text box
- Flexible image resizing
- Smarter eraser: Optionally, only erase highlighting strokes
- More covers and paper templates
- Fresh & modern design, increased stability & performance, and a lot more

To read more about what's new in GoodNotes 5, visit our blog on medium.goodnotes.com or our website goodnotes.com.

This update fixes a problem with iCloud sync from a former update. Further fixes included in this version:
- fixed an issue that caused images to disappear when copying and pasting pages
- improved the speed of opening documents and loading and closing document titles
- changed some wordings and made cosmetical improvements 

Previous fixes:
- fixed lag when writing on the first page of a document
- fixed a bug that caused notes to reappear after erasing them
- fixed a crash that was caused by typing with the text tool
- fixed a crash that happened for some people when opening the app

You can find more information about known issues, troubleshooting, how to guides and more on support.goodnotes.com.

This update adds the bookmarks feature from GoodNotes 4, now called “Custom Outlines”.

## How to use Custom Outlines ##

Document outlines allow you to quickly navigate to specific pages in your documents from the Outlines tab in the thumbnail view. 

You can add pages to the document outline and set a name for them, by following one of the options below:

1. Tap on the ... button in the navigation bar of an open page and tap "Add this page to Outline"
2. Open the thumbnail view and tap on the arrow next to the page number and tap "Add Page to Outline"

You will then be asked to insert a title for the outline item, which will appear next to the page in the thumbnail view and in the outlines tab.
A page can be added to the outline multiple times, and thus can have multiple labels. 
To remove an outline item in the Outlines tab, swipe from right to left on the item.

## Migrating old bookmarks from V4 to Outline Items ##

If you migrated your GoodNotes 4 documents to GoodNotes 5, your old bookmarks were converted to "Favorites". You can convert them to Outline items in Menu > Settings > Document Editing. Favorites you added in GoodNotes 5 won't be affected by this conversion. 

## Other fixes & improvements in 5.0.15 ##

- Fixed freezes after exporting to Mail app
- Fixed freeze when using the text tool
- Fixed unexpected Bluetooth alert when Bluetooth is disabled in Settings
- Optimized eraser performance

In this update, we fixed a bug that caused document corruption after failing to import Office documents. This bug resulted in the following symptoms in the corrupted documents:

- New pages were added to incorrect positions in the document
- Some pages couldn't be added to "Favorites"
- Pages couldn't be moved
- Pages couldn't be deleted
- Pages couldn't be copied with the alert "Page is not found"
- Blank documents after reinstalling the app
- Incorrect page numbers

Recovering already corrupted documents:
We will release another update in a few days, that will allow you to recover already corrupted documents. Until then, please do not reinstall GoodNotes or restore from an iCloud backup. This will prevent the recovery from working. If you need to work with the corrupted documents in the meantime, export them as PDF and import them again, if possible. 


Further fixes and improvements in this version:

- Fix a crash when exporting folders without document inside
- Improved status bar tap behavior with vertical scrolling. Tapping the status bar won't scroll to the top of the document anymore but to the top of the current page.
- Added support for "dynamic type" in More (...) menu

In this update, we added gesture control for undo and redo. Here's how it works:

- Tap the screen twice with two fingers to undo your last edit
- Tap the screen twice with three fingers to redo your last edit

Both gestures work anywhere on the paper, also while writing in the Zoom Window.

INTRODUCING PRESENTATION MODE

GoodNotes 5 now supports Presentation Mode. It lets you convert your iPad into a distraction-free digital whiteboard for more engaging presentations, classes, and lectures. Presentation mode lets you hide all distractions on an external screen when you connect your device via HDMI or AirPlay. 

Details:
- Laser Pointer is now always available in the swipeable toolbar
- Laser Pointer supports two different styles: dot and trail
- Presentation Mode supports three preferences that determine what your audience sees on the external screen
- Presentation Mode preference can be set under the Share button

You can find more information about presentation mode, including tips, guides, and best practices on goodnotes.com/presentation-mode.

This update adds full compatibility for iPadOS and iOS 13, including support for multiple windows, dark mode, OCR document scanning and undo/redo gestures.

For tips, tricks and more information about the new features, visit goodnotes.com/ipad-os.

### Introducing multiple windows in GoodNotes (requires iPadOS) ###
You can now open GoodNotes in multiple windows to view two documents side by side, view two pages of the same document in Split View, or pair it with other apps in spaces across your entire iPad. To open a new window, drag any of the elements listed below to the side of your screen:
- the app icon from the dock
- documents from the library
- folders from the library
- individual pages from the document thumbnail view
- tabs from the tab-bar
You can also use the buttons in the library action menu or from the tab-bar to open a new window.

If you're using presentation mode, we highly recommend you to check out the tips we shared on goodnotes.com/ipad-os to learn more about how you can leverage your presentations with multiple windows.

### OCR document scanning (requires iOS 13/iPadOS)###
Tap the + button in the library or in the document navigation bar to open your device's camera and use it to scan paper documents. GoodNotes recognizes printed text in all Latin-based languages, making it searchable. 

### iPadOS system gestures for undo/redo & multi-select ###
- Swipe left with three fingers to undo the last edit, and right to redo the last edit.
- Place two fingers in the library view or thumbnail view and then start swiping to select multiple items quickly

### Dark Mode & new paper templates (requires iOS 13/iPadOS)###
Activating Dark Mode in the control center will give GoodNotes a cool new look that is easier on the eyes. We also introduced a new set of dark paper templates to GoodNotes that you can choose from the template library when creating a new notebook, adding pages to existing documents, or changing the paper template of the current page. Existing background colors of pages won't change automatically because the color is static.

This update adds full compatibility for iPadOS and iOS 13, including support for multiple windows, dark mode, OCR document scanning and undo/redo gestures.

For tips, tricks and more information about the new features, visit goodnotes.com/ipad-os.

We also introduced a new set of dark paper templates to GoodNotes that you can choose from the template library when creating a new notebook, adding pages to existing documents, or changing the paper template of the current page. Existing background colors of pages won't change automatically because the color is static.
This field is required.

### Fixes in 5.3.1
- fixed iOS 13 and iPadOS related crashes
- fixed some occasional crashes introduced in 5.3

### Fixes in 5.3.2
- Fixed some occasional crashes introduced in 5.3.
- Fixed missing line height for zoom window in dark paper templates.
- Minor improvements to tabs and multi-window support. You can now drag the document title to the tab bar in another window.

### Introducing multiple windows in GoodNotes (requires iPadOS) ###
You can now open GoodNotes in multiple windows to view two documents side by side, view two pages of the same document in Split View, or pair it with other apps in spaces across your entire iPad. To open a new window, drag any of the elements listed below to the side of your screen:
- the app icon from the dock
- documents from the library
- folders from the library
- individual pages from the document thumbnail view
- tabs from the tab-bar
You can also use the buttons in the library action menu or from the tab-bar to open a new window.

If you're using presentation mode, we highly recommend you to check out the tips we shared on goodnotes.com/ipad-os to learn more about how you can leverage your presentations with multiple windows.

### OCR document scanning (requires iOS 13/iPadOS)###
Tap the + button in the library or in the document navigation bar to open your device's camera and use it to scan paper documents. GoodNotes recognizes printed text in all Latin-based languages, making it searchable.

- Place two fingers in the library view or thumbnail view and then start swiping to select multiple items quickly

- Updated the button for adding pages on the navigation bar
- Other internal changes, performance and stability improvements

INTRODUCING AUTO-BACKUP IN GOODNOTES 5

Auto-Backup uploads the latest version of your documents in PDF and/or GoodNotes format to one of the following cloud storages automatically: Google Drive, Dropbox, or OneDrive.

In GoodNotes 5, we added the option to backup in both formats at the same time, so that you can access your documents as PDF versions from anywhere but still have a copy in GoodNotes format that you can further edit and change with GoodNotes on any device. 

Auto-backup is a one-directional sync that saves a copy of your documents in the selected cloud storage where you can access them. Changes you make to the backup in your cloud storages will not sync with GoodNotes on your iPad or iPhone.


HOW TO ENABLE AUTO-BACKUP

1. Enable "Automatic Backup" in GoodNotes > Menu > Settings > Automatic Backup
2. Chose to sign into a cloud storage
3. Select your desired cloud storage
4. Type in your account details
5. Optionally, change the file format or the destination folder in the same menu

To learn more about auto-backup, visit goodnotes.com/auto-backup.

1. Enable "Automatic Backup" in GoodNotes > Menu > Settings > Automatic Backup
2. Chose to sign into a cloud storage
3. Select your desired cloud storage
4. Type in your account details
5. Optionally, change the file format or the destination folder in the same menu

To learn more about auto-backup, visit goodnotes.com/auto-backup.

INTRODUCING AUTO-BACKUP IN GOODNOTES 5

Auto-Backup uploads the latest version of your documents in PDF and/or GoodNotes format to one of the following cloud storages automatically: Google Drive, Dropbox, or OneDrive.

In GoodNotes 5, we added the option to backup in both formats at the same time, so that you can access your documents as PDF versions from anywhere but still have a copy in GoodNotes format that you can further edit and change with GoodNotes on any device.

INTRODUCING SHARED DOCUMENTS

Finding new ways to work together with other people is now more important than ever. This update adds the ability to share documents with other GoodNotes users and edit them together. 

## How to share a document
1. Open a document in GoodNotes and tap on the Share icon
2. Tap on "Collaborate" and enable "Link Sharing"
3. Copy the link to your clipboard or send it directly to other people so that they can open it on their iOS & iPadOS devices and accept the shared document

You can find more information on all new features and instructions on how to use them on goodnotes.com/shared-documents

## What you can use shared documents for
Shared documents are incredibly versatile. Here's some inspiration what you could use them for:
- Ask someone else to leave comments an annotations on a PDF document you drafted
- Share notes with your classmates to check if you understood everything from your last lecture correctly
- Collect signatures or feedback on a document from a group of people
- Make your meeting notes available to your entire team immediately
- Share grocery shopping lists, calendars, journals, and more with your family members
- Read and annotate a book together
- Correct someone's homework
- Brainstorm with your team
- Play Tic Tac Toe or Battleships with friends
- Plan a home renovation project and even share it with your interior designer to get their feedback

Changes to shared documents sync via iCloud and take around 15-30 seconds to show up on other devices. Currently, anyone with the link can open and edit a shared document in GoodNotes. We recommend sharing documents with trusted people only.

Happy sharing!

OTHER RELEASE NOTES
- added a page number indicator when scrolling. This can be disabled in Menu > Settings > Document Editing
- fixed a crash that happened occasionally when exporting documents
- fixed some minor design issues

INTRODUCING SHARED DOCUMENTS

Finding new ways to work together with other people is now more important than ever. This update adds the ability to share documents with other GoodNotes users and edit them together. 

## How to share a document
1. Open a document in GoodNotes and tap on the Share icon
2. Tap on "Collaborate" and enable "Link Sharing"
3. Copy the link to your clipboard or send it directly to other people so that they can open it on their iOS & iPadOS devices and accept the shared document

You can find more information on all new features and instructions on how to use them on goodnotes.com/shared-documents

## What you can use shared documents for
Shared documents are incredibly versatile. Here's some inspiration what you could use them for:
- Ask someone else to leave comments an annotations on a PDF document you drafted
- Share notes with your classmates to check if you understood everything from your last lecture correctly
- Collect signatures or feedback on a document from a group of people
- Make your meeting notes available to your entire team immediately
- Share grocery shopping lists, calendars, journals, and more with your family members
- Read and annotate a book together
- Correct someone's homework
- Brainstorm with your team
- Play Tic Tac Toe or Battleships with friends
- Plan a home renovation project and even share it with your interior designer to get their feedback

Changes to shared documents sync via iCloud and take around 15-30 seconds to show up on other devices. Currently, anyone with the link can open and edit a shared document in GoodNotes. We recommend sharing documents with trusted people only.

Happy sharing!

OTHER RELEASE NOTES
- added a page number indicator when scrolling. This can be disabled in Menu > Settings > Document Editing
- fixed a crash that happened occasionally when exporting documents
- fixed some minor design issues

This version fixes a bug where sync indicator (cloud icon) keeps showing with down arrow after successful sync.

We're excited to introduce improved shape drawing and updates to the text tool: Draw and hold with the pen and highlighter, support for curves, subsequent shape editing, faster text style selection, text box drop shadow and more. Here's what's new:

### Draw and hold
- Draw a stroke with the pen or highlighter tool and hold down with your finger or stylus at the end of the stroke to convert it to a perfect shape or line
- Continue holding down and drag your finger/stylus across the screen to resize or rotate the shape
- This adds back the ability to draw shapes with the highlighter that many of you missed from GoodNotes 4

### Select shapes
- Tap on a shape using your finger or the shapes tool to select it
- You can now edit it using the points on the lines
- To resize or rotate a shape use the lasso tool

### Draw curves
- We're introducing curves as a new shape in this update
- You can change the slope of a curve when editing it

### More options for shape drawing
- You can disable "Draw and Hold" in the pen tool options. Tap on the pen tool icon in the toolbar twice to access them
- Strokes you draw can snap to other stroke endpoints which allows you to create perfect shapes with multiple strokes. If the shape is closed, it can be selected and edited as a whole instead of only selecting the single lines


### New “selected state” for text boxes
- Tapping on a text box once will select it so that you can make edits to the text box as a whole without bringing up the keyboard right away
- You can move selected text boxes or change the style easily
- Double tap on a text box to start typing

### New toolbar layout and styles
- The text tool receives an improved contextual area so that the style options are easier to access
- A new drop shadow option has been added to the text box style options
- We updated the FontAPI so that custom system fonts are now visible in GoodNotes 5 on iOS 14

This build includes several bug fixes and performance improvements as well as a new experimental feature: Flash Cards.

## Study With Flash Cards
GoodNotes lets you create flash cards that you can study with the “Spaced Repetition” learning technique. 
- To create a flash card, add a new page using the “Flash Card” paper template
- Flash card paper is currently only available in the size “GoodNotes Standard Size” and can be found in the Essentials template group all the way on the right side
- Add the question on the top half and the answer on the bottom half. Tip: Use images, text, and handwriting to create great-looking and information-rich flash cards.
- To study all flash cards in a document (“the flash card deck”), tap on the ... menu and then on “Study Flash Cards”
- Tap on the screen to reveal the answer and then choose how easy it was to remember the answer.
- GoodNotes will suggest your next study date based on your learning progress and the selected difficulty of the cards. The more you study, the more accurate these suggestions will become. E.g.: You will see “hard” cards more often and sooner than “easy” cards.
- You can reset your entire learning progress for the current deck in the settings in the flash card studying screen. Note that this is not reversible and the entire progress for this deck is lost as if you would have never studied it before. 

## Other fixes & improvements
- added a dialogue for when there are incompatible sync versions installed that isn’t blocking you from using GoodNotes
- Fixed crashes related to the new shape and text features
- Fixed the multi-selection gesture for the library and page

Introducing Elements - Save and reuse frequently needed objects across all of your notebooks.

Stickers, stamps, headers, sticky-notes, basic shapes, graphs, coordinate systems... When taking notes, we need to use the same objects over and over again. The new Elements feature lets you import and save objects or groups of objects to a collection from where you can add them to the page again. No more copy and paste between different notebooks or hectic redrawing when time is short.


### SAVING ELEMENTS ###
GoodNotes comes with some built-in Element collections that you can use to decorate or enhance your notes. 
Of course, you can also add your own elements:
1. Select something with the Lasso Tool > tap on the selection again > tap “Add as Element”
2. Select an image with the Image tool > Then tap on it again > Add as Element
3. Open the Elements picker > tap and hold on the mini thumbnail of a collection at the bottom > “Edit” > Import images from Camera Roll or Files

### INSERTING ELEMENTS ###
Inserting elements work similarly to inserting images with the image tool:
Select the Elements tool > tap anywhere on the page > select the Element you want to insert.

You can also use drag and drop to add elements from the Elements picker or from the contextual area that includes your recently used Elements for faster access.

Tips for Pros:
When you save an Element, the format is preserved, which means all objects are fully editable when you add them back to a page. For example, you can save a hand-drawn table with placeholder text boxes for the table headers. After adding the Element to the page, you can update the placeholder text with the text tool or erase columns you don’t need.


### ORGANIZING ELEMENTS ###
Elements are organized in collections. When saving an element, you can choose to add it to an existing collection or create a new one. You can delete Elements in collections, move them around, and import more.

You can learn more about how to use Elements by visiting our blog on medium.goodnotes.com and following us on Instagram (@goodnotes.app) and on Twitter (@goodnotesapp).

-----

ADD A LINK IN TEXT BOX -  You can turn text in a text box into a link that opens a website! 

###Add a link### 
When a text box is being selected , double tap or long press to select text, select "Link" to specify details for the destination.
To verify the destination, tap "Back" and then click the button for "Open Link", otherwise, tap outside the popover to close

###Edit or remove a link###
Tap the linked text , then "Link Settings"  to either remove the link, or modify the destination by editing the "Link To" field.
